articles.author: Steve Holland, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump and his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin will not attend what could be the first direct peace talks between Moscow and Kyiv in three years on Thursday, the Kremlin sending instead a group of experienced technocrats.
articles.title: Putin, Trump to skip Ukraine's peace talks that Russian leader proposed

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli military strikes killed at least 50 Palestinians across the Gaza Strip on Wednesday, local health authorities said, in a significant escalation of the bombardment as U.S. President Donald Trump continued his visit to the Middle East.
articles.title: Israeli intensifies Gaza bombardment as Trump visits region

articles.author: Michelle Nichols, Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: A U.S.-backed humanitarian organization said on Wednesday that it would launch operations in Gaza by the end of May and has asked Israel to allow aid to start flowing into the enclave now under existing procedures until it is set up.
articles.title: US-backed aid group to start work in Gaza by end of May

articles.author: Lucy Craymer
articles.description: A New Zealand government committee on Wednesday recommended three Indigenous lawmakers be temporarily suspended from parliament following the performance of a haka during the reading of a contentious bill last year.
articles.title: New Zealand parliamentary committee recommends suspension of three indigenous politicians

articles.author: Nate Raymond
articles.description: A Russian-born scientist and research associate at Harvard University who has been held for weeks in an immigration detention center in Louisiana has been criminally charged with attempting to smuggle frog embryo samples into the United States.
articles.title: Detained Russian-born Harvard scientist criminally charged with smuggling

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: Australia's Prime Minister Anthony Albanese will meet with Indonesia President Prabowo Subianto on Thursday to discuss defence cooperation and global trade, after arriving in Jakarta on his first international visit since his re-election.
articles.title: Australia PM Albanese to meet Indonesia counterpart in first international visit since re-election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Who is Russian President Vladimir Putin sending to the peace talks with Ukraine that the Kremlin chief himself proposed?
articles.title: An aide, a diplomat and a spy: Who is Putin sending to Turkey?

articles.author: Mike Spector, David Shepardson
articles.description: The U.S. Justice Department on Friday plans to meet with the victims of two Boeing 737 MAX crashes that killed 346 people in 2018 and 2019 ahead of a June 23 trial date the planemaker faces, according to a letter reviewed by Reuters.
articles.title: US Justice Department to meet families of 737 MAX victims on Boeing criminal case

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The New Zealand government said on Thursday it would set up a new NZ$190 million ($112 million) social investment fund in its 2025 budget to make targeted investments designed to help improve the lives of its vulnerable people.
articles.title: New Zealand government to set up $112 million social investment fund

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Indian Army said at least 10 militants were killed in an operation still underway in the troubled northeastern state of Manipur, bordering Myanmar.
articles.title: Indian army operation on Myanmar border kills 10 insurgents
